page.title: 01SOHAM, Cambridgeshire
page.content: { SOHAM}is a small town in Cambridgeshire on the edge of the fens, and although it is a busy place, the recently opened by-pass has diverted much of the traffic.The town is growing as new housing is built. The town has a range of shops which cater for most everyday needs.There is a health centre, a new sports hall and a wide range of social clubs providing leisure activities. Children in Soham start their education at the Infant's School, continuing at the County Junior School (sometimes called The Shade) or at the Church of England Junior School before joining children from the surrounding villages at Soham Village College. Recreational facilities for children include a recreation ground and various clubs and organisations.
